content: the kilometre scarf is a soft double layered stockinette scarf with no visible wrong side it uses one kilometre of your preferred dk weight yarn to create a piece you ll reach for all winter sizes one size measurements the finished scarf measures approximately 25cm by 180cm you can knit it to your preferred length but if you would like it to be much longer you may end up needing more yarn needles 4 5mm circular needles 100cm and 40cm lengths gauge 20 stitches x 26 row on 4 5mm needles in stockinette yarn approximately 1000m of your preferred dk weight yarn or 1000m each of a fingering weight yarn and silk mohair the sample uses 5 skeins of cashmere from skall studio and 5 skeins of soft silk mohair from knitting for olive notions two stitch markers a needle to weave in ends techniques all the techniques used in this pattern are relatively beginner friendly these include - turkish cast on - magic loop - kitchener stitch abbreviations k knit bor beginning of round sts stitches pm place marker sm slip marker pattern begins here cast on 100 sts using a turkish cast on onto your 4 5mm 100cm circular needles this will involve wrapping the yarn 50 times and you will end up with 50 sts on each needle prepare to work in the round using the magic loop technique you shouldn t need to place a bor marker yet as it should be easy to identify that point from where the stitches are divided on the needles work in stockinette k all sts with the magic loop technique until the scarf measures 10cm from the cast on edge finish at the bor now switch to 40cm circular needles as follows using 4 5mm 40cm needles k 50 pm k 50 pm for bor continue to work in stockinette k all sts until the scarf is your desired length or until you run out of yarn leaving a tail long enough to knit one round and bind off the sample is knitted to approximately 180cm finish at the bor marker switch back to the longer circular needles as follows using 4 5mm 100cm needles rm for bor k 50 to marker rm slide the stitches down the needle as if starting to knit using the magic loop method k 50 at this point make sure any ends you wish to weave in or secure on the inside of the scarf are dealt with you can now use the needle to bind off all sts using kitchener stitch finishing weave in all ends wash and block the scarf i d be really happy to see any finished scarves shared on instagram under #kilometrescarf thanks florence instagram @handmadebyflorence
